3.text: Next, rinse and soak the rice.

4.text: To boil, you'll need 100 milliliters (3.4  fl oz) of cold water for every 100 grams of rice - that is, the weight of the rice before you let it soak, which in this example would mean 600 milliliters (20.3 fl.oz.

5.text: Watch over the pot until it starts to boil.

6.text: After the seven minutes have passed, you should turn the heat down from max power to just enough power to let the rice simmer for an additional fifteen minutes.

10.text: If you must refrigerate, then reheat by gently steaming or microwaving with a piece of lettuce leaf or cling wrap lightly covering the rice (so that it does not dry out) until the texture returns to that of soft, freshly cooked rice.

12.text: Put the rinsed and soaked rice into an 8x8 Pyrex dish.

13.text: Pour the same amount of already boiling water into the dish.

14.text: Cover the dish tightly with foil.

15.text: Place in the middle of the oven for 20 minutes.
